div.div:
MessageQueue has a handler object , and Refresh() calls handler'sÂ
dispatchRefresh()

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 218px; height: 1px; padding-top: 536px; margin-left: 68px;

div.div: dispatchRefresh() is wrapper for messageQueue's looper's sendMessage()

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 218px; height: 1px; padding-top: 676px; margin-left: 68px;

div.div: The sendMessage of messageQueue :: looper is responded by handleMessage of messageQueue.Â

div.div: handleMessage of messageQueue call's OnMessageReceived of surface Flinger

div.div: <Comment> This Signal Refresh is called inside the onMessageReceived() function of surface flinger, it may seem like cyclic loop But there are checks for bootstage:BOOTLOADER, yet to be explored

switch.text: <Comment> This Signal Refresh is called inside the onMessageReceived() function of surface flinger,...

div.div:
As like every other onTransact, this too has to be called by some binder , and this biner initiation is object is taken by taking the "SurfaceFlinger" service in SurfaceComposerClient.cpp @ function connectLocked() of ComposerService class.
Note: ComposorClient inherits singleton classÂ hence get instance method is available directly to composerClitent: Link2

switch.text: As like every other onTransact, this too has to be called by so...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 378px; height: 1px; padding-top: 331px; margin-left: 448px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
This binder us usually used to setup transactions and does no gives any signalrefresh or a message which may hint surface flinger to start compositing.
Hence we can say the calls ontransact calls of surface flinger is used toÂ debug the surface flinger and hence the composition of handling on vsync period is done at diffrent place. As this(Link1)Â link suggestsÂ is done through some call back of harware composer's generation on vsync and hence following on that line Starting with link3

switch.text: This binder us usually used to setup transactions and does no g...

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
Link2:
handleMessageRefresh
|â> preComposition
|â> rebuildLayerStacks
|â> setUpHWComposer
|â> HWComposer::createWorkList <== hwc="" structures="" are="" allocated="" |â=""> Layer::setGeometry()
|â set per frame data
|â HWComposer::prepare
|â> hwc prepare
|â> doComposition
|---- skip composition on external display if condition meets
|â> doDisplayComposition
| |â> doComposeSurfaces
| |â> DisplayDevice::swapBuffers
| |â> eglSwapBuffers
| |â> FramebufferSurface::advanceFrame
|â> DisplayDevice::flip(â¦) <== just="" update="" statistics="" count="" |--=""> Call DisplayDevice::compositionComplete(), notify each display
|--> DisplaySurface::compositionComplete()
|--> FramebufferSurface::compositionComplete()
|--> HWComposer::fbCompositionComplete()
|--> NoOP if HWC >= 1.1
|--> used only in framebuffer device case.
|â> postFrameBuffer
|â> HWComposer::commit
|â> hwc set
|â> update retireFenceFd of hwc_display_contents_1
|â> DisplayDevice::onSwapBuffersCompleted
|â> FramebufferSurface::onFrameComitted
|â> Layer::onLayerDisplayed
|â update some statistics
|â> postComposition
